text: <@U04UGLGMJ> Im actually using the simple-auth-torri package to handle authentication using google. I dont store any users in the db at this point so im not sure how much worth it will be to you. Feel free to take a look at <https://github.com/Sound-waves/sound-wav.es> for how to handle it on the frontend. Most of the stuff is in the login controller with mixins in other controllers to only allow access for logged in users.

attachments.title: Sound-waves/sound-wav.es
attachments.text: Contribute to <http://sound-wav.es|sound-wav.es> development by creating an account on GitHub.

text: As I say though im not sure how much use it would be to you. Feel free to hit me up though if you like. Its something i need to look into myself so I’d be happy to think about working on it fairly shortly
I’m using simple-auth-oauth2 , works a treat right out the box, just need to configure your back end to do all the hard work and return an accesstoken
